TopicTitle: [0.22] B9 Aerospace Pack / R4.0c / New pods, IVAs, engines, fuselages & structures

Articles.Content: There are seats on the side of it.

My god, how do they FIT in it? there must be some Kerbal Voodoo going on to let them shoehorn in that tiny thing!

It uses two seats by the looks of it.

Edit: Ninja'd

Damn it.
The wait for 2.6 is killing me.....

The wait for 2.6 is killing me.....

Same here, this pic pretty much sums it all up.

I can't wait until it's out. But, a reminder to Bac9 and Taverius; use the time you want, and don't release it before it's somewhat bug-free and balanced.

Edited May 26, 2013 by Hocki
Removed the epileptic .gif, and used a pic to illustrate instead.

Same here, this .gif pretty much sums it all up.

I can't wait until it's out. A reminder to Bac9 and Taverius; use the time you want, and don't release it before it's somewhat bug-free and balanced.

We can wait, and please don't think we are rushing you. There's a difference between suspenseful watching and nagging. We are not nagging.

Hi there!

Anyone managed to fly the Strugatsky really high?

I'm doing test flights, but the prograde keeps dropping from 14km and above.

At 18km it is at about 25Ã‚Â° lower from pitch and you can't really pitch higher than 25Ã‚Â°, because the drag flips you over.

Above 18km the prograde drops below zero and start losing height.

PS. I've put another pair of engines and a couple of radial intakes on each engine. Intake is not a problem.
did anyone else laugh so hard to the 'top gun' reference in the teaser pics they peed a bit, or was that just me....

Hi there!

Anyone managed to fly the Strugatsky really high?

I'm doing test flights, but the prograde keeps dropping from 14km and above.

At 18km it is at about 25Ã‚Â° lower from pitch and you can't really pitch higher than 25Ã‚Â°, because the drag flips you over.

Above 18km the prograde drops below zero and start losing height.

PS. I've put another pair of engines and a couple of radial intakes on each engine. Intake is not a problem.

Its supposed to be a subsonic cargo plane, so that's kind of by design.

In 2-6 its going to have even more takeoff thrust, even better fuel efficiency, and be even more limited in speed and operational ceiling.

If thats the plane im thinking of i made one similar to it just a diff cockpit and i got it to 20km and up to 900 m/s took me like 20 mins though had to ease her up

this photo does have a mistake in it though that i fixed later i used the wrong part it had rocket fuel in it

now this one is a bit different it doesnt use the radial intakes but if it did i think the ceiling would be around 17500m or a little under which would drop max speed down 500m/s

Edited May 26, 2013 by moxzot

B9 rocks!

It has enabled me to refine my cargo bay SSTO design down to ~350 parts! 40 tons+ of cargo dropped off in orbit at 2x warp on mechjeb autopilot and it is rock stable!

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/31940-B9-Mod-ESP-Extensible-Space-Plane-A-heavy-SSTO-with-bay-and-rear-ramp

OK so I had to mod the wings to stop them randomly exploding when you dropped out of warp or reloaded, but still, great work!

Edited May 26, 2013 by evilC

Has anyone else had issues with B9 pieces randomly falling off? Every time I come out of timewarp the wings of my ship let go and drift away into space. I even reinforced them with struts but it doesn't help.
Been covered before, there's a line that needs to be commented out, I don't remember which look back through the posts since .20 launched...
COMOffset, in the wings.
f5 f5 f5 f5 f5 f5 f5 .... Come ON!

Won't be tonight.

Snjo was kind enough to make a ModuleAnimateGeneric substitute for us with extra features, now I have to apply it to all parts that use ModuleAnimateGeneric in B9 (a lot)

You can see more about the features here: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/showthread.php/24551-Firespitter-propeller-plane-and-helicopter-parts-v5-0-%28May-25th%29-for-KSP-0-20-0?p=393953&viewfull=1#post393953
Arrg!!!... Oh well. Is there a good chance it will be tomorrow?
i think its cool how the engine can now have reverse thrust i dont see me using it or using it much but its still nice to have if you want it
just curious in reverse the thrust should be weaker am i right i see it being like 40% normal thrust

Won't be tonight.

Any chance on a timeline?

Any chance on a timeline?

Here ya go

A very useful timeline

This seemed to be missing some key events, and was innacurate in others. For example, Hitler was the Chancellor, and the 8.7 magnitude earthquake that hit Sumatra November 25, 1833 wasn't included.
Wait Hitler existed???!!! No im kidding cute time line XD
